symptoms.name: Skin lesions
symptoms.pattern: Violaceous pink to purple plaques or nodules on skin or mucocutaneous surfaces; may ulcerate or invade nearby tissues; lesions may be painful with associated lymphedema and secondary infection; can occur on face, arms, legs, genitals, or in the mouth; can also involve lymph nodes, lungs, and gastrointestinal system

symptoms.name: Gastrointestinal symptoms
symptoms.pattern: May occur if lesions are present in the digestive tract

symptoms.name: Respiratory symptoms
symptoms.pattern: May occur if lesions are present in the lungs

physical_findings: Violaceous pink to purple plaques or nodules on the skin or mucocutaneous surfaces
risk_factors: Infection with Kaposi sarcoma-associated herpesvirus (KSHV) or human herpesvirus 8 (HHV-8)
Eastern European or Mediterranean descent (classic Kaposi sarcoma)
Male sex (increased risk in classic and iatrogenic Kaposi sarcoma)
Male homosexuals (increased risk in AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma)

required: Presence of characteristic skin lesions (patches, plaques, nodules)
Confirmation of HHV-8 infection (e.g., immunohistochemistry for LANA1)
supportive: Histopathological examination showing spindle cell proliferation, complex vascular channels, and extravasated red blood cells
